recipes.name: Chocolate Cakesicles
recipes.description: These chocolate cakesicles are a fun and tasty twist on traditional cake pops. Made with rich chocolate cake and coated in creamy chocolate, they're perfect for any occasion.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
Mix the cake mix, vegetable oil, eggs, and water in a large bowl until well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool completely, then crumble it into a large bowl.
Form the cake crumbs into small balls or cylinders, and insert a popsicle stick into each one.
In a small bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Dip each cakesicle into the glaze, and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Refrigerate the cakesicles until the glaze is set, then serve and enjoy!

recipes.name: Vanilla Cakesicles
recipes.description: These vanilla cakesicles are a delicious and refreshing treat that everyone will love. Made with fluffy vanilla cake and coated in a sweet vanilla glaze, they're perfect for a hot summer day.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
Mix the cake mix, vegetable oil, eggs, and water in a large bowl until well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool completely, then crumble it into a large bowl.
Form the cake crumbs into small balls or cylinders, and insert a popsicle stick into each one.
In a small bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Dip each cakesicle into the glaze, and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Refrigerate the cakesicles until the glaze is set, then serve and enjoy!

recipes.name: Strawberry Cakesicles
recipes.description: These vanilla cakesicles are a delicious and refreshing treat that everyone will love. Made with fluffy vanilla cake and coated in a sweet vanilla glaze, they're perfect for a hot summer day.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
Mix the cake mix, vegetable oil, eggs, and water in a large bowl until well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let the cake cool completely, then crumble it into a large bowl.
Form the cake crumbs into small balls or cylinders, and insert a popsicle stick into each one.
In a small bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, milk, and strawberry extract until smooth.
Dip each cakesicle into the glaze, and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Refrigerate the cakesicles until the glaze is set, then serve and enjoy!
